task_summary: Perceive the T-block and target, approach with a circular end-effector, establish gentle contact, push along a short 2-segment path to align the block to the target outline, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style arm with a circular tool must push a T-shaped block to a fixed target outline on a tabletop. The plan first localizes both the block and the goal, then approaches above the block, aligns the tool, lowers until contact, and executes a two-segment push to seat the block inside the target outline. The interaction is non-prehensile (no grasp). Timeouts bound each stage, with gentle contact before pushing and a brief settle wait after retreat.
preconditions: Block and goal area visible to perception
stepwise_plan: Scan and detect the T-block and goal outline
Move above and align to the push direction
Lower until contact with low force
Perform first long push toward the goal
Perform a short orthogonal push for final alignment
success_criteria: Block pose overlaps target outline within visual tolerance
No loss of contact during push segments
Tool retreats clear of the object at end
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, rescan the scene
If misalignment occurs, re-approach and realign before re-pushing
If contact not detected within bounds, reset height and try again
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful alignment and a clean retreat with the tool clear of the block.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Raster scan to localize the T-block
Raster scan to localize the goal outline
Move above the block to pre-push height
Align tool relative to push direction
Establish gentle contact with the block
Set tool yaw for pushing trajectory

failure_modes: Object not detected due to glare or occlusion
Contact not established leading to sliding without control
recovery_strategy: Re-approach with lower height and re-align
Adjust yaw and repeat push sequence
Abort and retreat if unexpected forces spike
assumptions: In the frames, the T-block appears red and the target outline blue, differing from the gray/green colors stated; behavior is grounded on the frames while noting this mismatch

expected_success_criteria: Block final pose within outline with minimal gap
Clean retreat with no object displacement
